summary: This document is a series of internal FBI emails from late June to early July 2020 regarding the planning and approval for travel and expenses to arrest a target (Ghislaine Maxwell) in the Epstein investigation. The emails discuss shifting the operation from Massachusetts to New Hampshire to locate Maxwell's phone and make the arrest.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Referred to as the target of the FBI arrest operation in the Epstein investigation. The emails discuss locating her phone and planning her arrest.

events.title: FBI planning for Maxwell arrest operation
events.description: Internal FBI email chain discussing and approving travel, expenses, and logistical planning for an operation to arrest Ghislaine Maxwell. The plan shifts from Massachusetts to New Hampshire based on phone location data.

events.title: Execution of search warrant pending
events.description: An email states the team is waiting for a search warrant to be signed before executing it, indicating imminent law enforcement action.

keyFacts: The FBI was actively planning the arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell in late June/early July 2020.
The operation involved shifting resources from Boston and Newark to New Hampshire based on historical phone location data indicating Maxwell was there.
The emails detail cost estimates and approval for travel, lodging, and per diem for approximately 3-4 FBI personnel.
The arrest plan involved driving to the location, possibly escorting the target back to New York, and using technical assets to locate Maxwell's phone.
An SCN (likely a Significant Case Notification) was to be submitted immediately upon Maxwell's arrest.
